00024 #include "TransientData.hpp"
00025 #include "FrequencyData.hpp"
00026 #include "util/unit.hpp"
00027 #include <iostream>
00028 #include <fstream>
00029 #include <stdexcept>
00030 #include <iterator>
00031 
00032 
00033 using namespace std;
00034 using namespace pwiz::data;
00035 using namespace pwiz::util;
00036 
00037 
00038 ostream* os_ = 0;
00039 
00040 
00041 const double startTime_ = 0.116800;
00042 const double observationDuration_ = .768;
00043 const double A_ = 1.075339687500000e+008;
00044 const double B_ = -3.454602661132810e+008;
00045 const unsigned int sampleCount_ = 100;
00046 
00047 
00048 string filename_ = "TransientDataTest_test.dat";
00049 string filenameText_ = "TransientDataTest_test.dat.txt";
00050 
00051  
00052 void createTestTransients()
00053 {
00054     TransientData td;
00055     td.startTime(startTime_);
00056     td.observationDuration(observationDuration_);
00057     td.A(A_);
00058     td.B(B_);
00059 
00060     td.data().resize(sampleCount_);
00061     fill(td.data().begin(), td.data().end(), 1);
00062     
00063     td.write(filename_);
00064     td.write(filenameText_, TransientData::Text);
00065 }
00066 
00067 
00068 void testBasic(const TransientData& td)
00069 {
00070     unit_assert(td.startTime() == startTime_); 
00071     unit_assert(td.data().size() == sampleCount_); 
00072     unit_assert_equal(td.observationDuration(), observationDuration_, 1e-12);
00073     unit_assert_equal(td.A(), A_, 1e-12);
00074     unit_assert_equal(td.B(), B_, 1e-3);
00075     unit_assert_equal(td.bandwidth(), sampleCount_/observationDuration_/2, 1e-10);
00076 
00077     unit_assert(td.data().size() == sampleCount_);
00078     for (unsigned int i=0; i<sampleCount_; i++)
00079         unit_assert(td.data()[i] == 1);
00080     
00081     if (os_) *os_ 
00082         << setprecision(12)
00083         << "Start time: " << td.startTime() << endl
00084         << "Observation duration: " << td.observationDuration() << endl
00085         << "Calibration parameter A: " << td.A() << endl
00086         << "Calibration parameter B: " << td.B() << endl
00087         << "Number of samples: " << td.data().size() << endl
00088         << "Bandwidth: " << td.bandwidth() << endl
00089         << "Magnetic field = " << td.magneticField() << endl << endl;
00090 }
00091 
00092 
00093 void test()
00094 {
00095     createTestTransients();
00096 
00097     TransientData td(filename_);
00098     testBasic(td);
00099 
00100     TransientData tdText(filenameText_);
00101     testBasic(tdText);
00102 
00103     system(("rm " + filename_).c_str());
00104     system(("rm " + filenameText_).c_str());
00105 }
00106 
00107 
00108 class TestSignal : public TransientData::Signal
00109 {
00110     public:
00111 
00112     virtual double operator()(double t) const
00113     {
00114         // sum of two decaying sinusoids at frequencies 100000 and 101000
00115         return exp(-t)*(cos(100000*2*M_PI*t) + cos(101000*2*M_PI*t));
00116     }
00117 };
00118 
00119 
00120 void testAdd()
00121 {
00122     if (os_) *os_ << "testAdd()\n";
00123 
00124     if (os_) *os_ << "creating signal with two peaks\n";
00125 
00126     TransientData td;
00127     td.observationDuration(.768);
00128     td.A(A_);
00129     td.B(B_);
00130 
00131     td.data().resize(1048576);
00132     td.add(TestSignal());
00133 
00134     if (os_) *os_ << "computing fft\n";
00135 
00136     FrequencyData fd;
00137     td.computeFFT(1, fd);
00138 
00139     // "peak detection"  
00140 
00141     double threshold = 100000 * fd.noiseFloor();
00142     vector<FrequencyDatum> peaks;
00143 
00144     for (FrequencyData::iterator it=fd.data().begin(); it!=fd.data().end(); ++it)
00145         if (abs(it->y) > threshold)
00146             peaks.push_back(*it);
00147 
00148     if (os_)
00149     {
00150         *os_ << "found peaks: " << peaks.size() << endl;
00151         copy(peaks.begin(), peaks.end(), ostream_iterator<FrequencyDatum>(*os_, "\n"));
00152     }
00153     
00154     unit_assert(peaks.size() == 2);
00155     unit_assert(peaks[0].x == 100000);
00156     unit_assert(peaks[1].x == 101000);
00157 }
00158 
00159 
00160 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00161 {
00162     try
00163     {
00164         if (argc>1 && !strcmp(argv[1],"-v")) os_ = &cout;
00165         if (os_) *os_ << "TransientDataTest\n";
00166         test();
00167         testAdd();
00168         return 0;
00169     }
00170     catch (exception& e)
00171     {
00172         cerr << e.what() << endl;
00173         return 1;
00174     }
00175 }
